definition: a high open area of land that is not used for farming, especially an area covered with rough grass and heather
land that consists of moors
the form and structure of animals and plants, studied as a science
the forms of words, studied as a branch of linguistics
the state of being human and not living forever
the number of deaths in a particular situation or period of time
a death
a very small green or yellow plant without flowers that spreads over wet surfaces, rocks, trees, etc.
a person who moves from place to place, job to job, etc. does not have a lot of money, possessions or friends but is free from responsibilities
a road vehicle with two wheels, driven by an engine, with one seat for the driver and often a seat for a passenger behind the driver
a very high hill, often with rocks near the top
a very large amount or number of something; the very large size of something/somebody
to make an unimportant matter seem important
to make a great effort to do something
the sport or activity of climbing mountains
material, for example, decaying leaves, that you put around a plant to protect its base and its roots, to improve the quality of the soil or to stop weeds growing
a town, city or district with its own local government; the group of officials who govern it
a building in which objects of artistic, cultural, historical or scientific interest are kept and shown to the public
a fungus with a round flat head and short stem. Many mushrooms can be eaten.
sounds that are arranged in a way that is pleasant or exciting to listen to. People sing music or play it on instruments.
the art of writing or playing music
the written or printed signs that represent the sounds to be played or sung in a piece of music
to accept and deal with criticism or punishment for something you have done
news or information that you are very pleased to hear
different in some way from others of the same kind because of a change in its genetic structure

a process in which the genetic material of a person, a plant or an animal changes in structure when it is passed on to children, etc., causing different physical characteristics to develop; a change of this kind
a change in the form or structure of something
the scientific study of fungi
the feeling that you have when you want to vomit, for example because you are sick or are shocked or frightened by something
the death of most or all of the cells in an organ or tissue caused by injury, disease or a loss of blood supply
to require something/somebody because they are essential or very important, not just because you would like to have them
used to show what you should or have to do
to be crazy
a worm with a thin body that is shaped like a tube and not divided into sections
a chemical element. Nickel is a hard silver-white metal used in making some types of steel and other alloys.
a coin of the US and Canada worth 5 cents
a compound containing nitrogen and oxygen. There are several different nitrates and they are used especially to make soil better for growing crops.
a compound containing nitrogen and oxygen. There are several different nitrites.
a chemical element. Nitrogen is a gas that is found in large quantities in the earth’s atmosphere.
a sound, especially when it is loud, unpleasant or frightening
extra electrical or electronic signals that are not part of the signal that is being broadcast or transmitted and which may damage it
information that is not wanted and that can make it difficult for the important or useful information to be seen clearly
an important person
to complain loudly
to talk in an indirect way about something that you think you might do
to complain about something
to make remarks of the kind mentioned, even when that is not what you really think
a member of a community that moves with its animals from place to place
a system of naming things, especially in a branch of science
a situation or a pattern of behaviour that is usual or expected
standards of behaviour that are typical of or accepted within a particular group or society
a required or agreed standard, amount, etc.
